Detailed Description

template<class T = double> template class VectorBase

This is a pure virtual base class. The classes ColumnVector and RowVector are derived from this class.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

The default constructor.

~VectorBase ( ) [inline, virtual]
 

The default destructor.

Member Function Documentation

T * getElementsPointer ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

returns the pointer to the first element in a vector.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, and RowVector.

T getElement ( int elementPosition ) const [pure virtual]
 

returns the element at the specified position.

Parameters:
position   Position of the desired element.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, and RowVector.

void setElement ( int elementPosition,
T elementValue ) [pure virtual]
 

Sets an element to a value at the specified position.

Parameters:
position   Position of the desired element.
elementValue   The desired element is set to this value.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, and RowVector.

int getNumElements ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

returns the number of elements in the vector. See the overloaded functions in the derived classes ColumnVector and RowVector.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, and RowVector.

bool isRowVector ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

Returns:
TRUE if the vector instantiated is a row-vector.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, and RowVector.

bool isColumnVector ( ) const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE if the vector instantiated is a column-vector.

VectorBase< T >& operator=<T> ( const VectorBase< T >& vectorBase )
 

Overloading the assignment operator to assign between two VectorBase types of of same sizes and type.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, RowVector, and Vector.

MatrixInitializer< T > operator=<T> ( const T & elementValue ) [pure virtual]
 

This function provides an overloaded assignment operator for initializing a vector object.

Parameters:
elementValue   This is the value to which all elements in the matrix are initialized.

Reimplemented in ColumnVector, RowVector, and Vector.

void output ( ostream & outputStream = cout )
 

Returns:
The elements in the referenced vector to the output stream (by default the output is to the console)
